TOSCA Resource Data Model element or CSA:
**tosca.capabilities.nfv.Metric** - type for monitoring 

**monitoring_parameter** of above type per VNF/VDU/Vlink

- Note: currently the Metric node definition is empty. Need more discussion in modeling team
Testing directory in CSAR supported by ETSI SOL004

The playbooks should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory and may be referred in VNF-D LCM constructs 

- Note: if VNF vendor support this,VNF Package/Descriptor should contain this, otherwise, VNF vendor could ignore this

The cookbooks should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory and may be referred in VNF-D LCM. 

- Note: if VNF vendor support this, VNF Package/Descriptor should contain this, otherwise,VNF vendor could ignore this. constructs
The JSON files should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory and should be referred by VNF-D LCM actions
This should be handled in conjunction with TOSCA policy constructs in VNF-D (element group, affinity/anti-affinity etc.) - TBD in ETSI SOL001

The credentials should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory and their content may be encrypted using a symmetric encryption approach as specified in ETSI SOL004

- Note: if VNF vendor support this,VNF Package/Descriptor should contain this, otherwise, VNF vendor could ignore this
The YANG code should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory for YANG code and may be referred by TOSCA LCM constructs in VNF-D

All run-time scripts should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory for YANG code and should be referred by TOSCA LCM within  VNF-D when VNF action is required 

- Note: if VNF vendor support this, VNF Package/Descriptor should contain this, otherwise, VNF vendor could ignore this

Local artifact in CSAR:

ROOT\\Artifacts\\ **VNF_Image.bin**
or external referred in Manifest file/VNF Descriptor

- Note: Currently, ONAP doesn't have the capability of Image management, we upload the image into VIM/VNFM manually.
The XML file should be located in a CSAR directory dedicated to the run-time VNF actions the errors correspond to
The YANG model should be located in a dedicated CSAR directory for YANG configuration code

metadata property for OS::Nova::Server resource type.
Metadata parameters vnf_name, vnf_id, vf_module_id, vf_module_name, vm_role.
OS::Nova::Server metadata parameter vnf_id in environment
OS::Nova::Server metadata parameter vf_module_id in environment file.
OS::Nova::Server metadata parameter vnf_name in the   environment file.
contain   int_{network-role} in the parameter name.
{network-role}_net_id for the Neutron network ID {network-role}_net_name for the network name in OpenStack
int_{network-role}net_id for the Neutron network ID int{network-role}_net_name for the network name in OpenStack
{network-role}_subnet_id if the subnet is an IPv4 subnet {network-role}_v6_subnet_id if the subnet is an IPv6 subnet
fixed_ips and Map Property subnet_id parameter
include   {vm-type} and {network-role} in the parameter name
property fixed_ips and Map Property ip_address is declared type: comma_delimited_list: {vm-type}{network-role}_ips for IPv4 address {vm-type}{network-role}_v6_ips for IPv6 address
property fixed_ips and Map Property ip_address is declared type: string: {vm-type}{network-role}_ip{index} for an IPv4 address {vm-type}{network-role}_v6_ip{index} for an IPv6 address
property fixed_ips and Map Property ip_address is declared type: comma_delimited_list: {vm-type}int{network-role}ips for IPv4 address {vm-type}_int{network-role}_v6_ips for IPv6 address
property fixed_ips and Map Property ip_address is declared type: string: {vm-type}int{network-role}ip{index} for an IPv4 address {vm-type}int{network-role}v6_ip{index} for an IPv6 address

allowed_address_pairs and Map Property ip_address parameter, when the parameter is referencing an “external” network: {vm-type}{network-role}_floating_ip for an IPv4 address {vm-type}{network-role}_floating_v6_ip for an IPv6 address

allowed_address_pairs and Map Property ip_address parameter when the parameter is referencing an “internal” network. {vm-type}int{network-role}floating_ip for an IPv4 address {vm-type}_int{network-role}_floating_v6_ip for an IPv6 address
